summary: The text discusses the establishment and functions of the Nepal Lalitkala Pragya Pratisthan Act of 2064, which aims to protect and promote various forms of art in Nepal. The Act establishes the central office in Kathmandu and allows for the opening of branches in different locations as needed. It also outlines the roles and responsibilities of the organization in promoting and preserving art and culture in the country.
